li.klass.fhem.billing
Class PurchaseDatabase

java.lang.Object
  li.klass.fhem.billing.PurchaseDatabase

public class PurchaseDatabase
extends java.lang.Object

An example database that records the state of each purchase. You should use an obfuscator before storing any information to persistent storage. The obfuscator should use a key that is specific to the device and/or user. Otherwise an attacker could copy a database full of valid purchases and distribute it to others.

Method Detail

updatePurchase

public int updatePurchase(java.lang.String orderId,
                          java.lang.String productId,
                          BillingConstants.PurchaseState purchaseState,
                          long purchaseTime,
                          java.lang.String developerPayload)
Adds the given purchase information to the database and returns the total number of times that the given product has been purchased.

Parameters:
orderId - a string identifying the order
productId - the product ID (sku)
purchaseState - the purchase state of the product
purchaseTime - the time the product was purchased, in milliseconds since the epoch (Jan 1, 1970)
developerPayload - the developer provided "payload" associated with the order
Returns:
the number of times the given product has been purchased.

queryAllPurchasedItems

public android.database.Cursor queryAllPurchasedItems()
Returns a cursor that can be used to read all the rows and columns of the "purchased items" table.
